explain: Roberto Martinez had to come to the defense of his player Leighton Baines after he missed a penalty in the match against Burnley on Saturday.

Ross Barkley, the English midfielder for Everton, missed a penalty kick in the 10th minute of the game against Burnley on Saturday, November 14th, 2015. This aspect of the game is important as missed penalties can cost a team a victory, especially when the margin of error is so small. 

Analyze given aspect in context of summary.
Analysis: Ross Barkley's missed penalty kick took away an early opportunity to gain an advantage over Burnley. However, Everton was able to secure a 1-0 win with a goal from Leighton Baines, who has a successful record of scoring penalties for the team. This aspect of the game highlights the importance of taking advantage of scoring opportunities and having players who are reliable from the penalty spot. 

Evaluate given aspect within the larger context of the game.
Evaluation: While Barkley's missed penalty could have been costly, Everton was still able to win the game. It also allowed for Leighton Baines to step up and contribute to the win with his successful penalty kick. Ultimately, the game showed the importance of being able to capitalize on scoring opportunities, regardless of who is taking the kick.

The aspect states that despite Ross Barkley missing from the spot in Everton's 1-0 win over Burnley in the Premier League, Leighton Baines has been a reliable penalty taker for the team, converting 15 out of 16 attempts in league games.
Leighton Baines, Everton's left-back, has been very efficient from the penalty spot, scoring 15 times out of 16 attempts in the Premier League.

The aspect highlights that despite having veteran Leighton Baines on the team who has a successful track record of scoring from penalties, manager Roberto Martinez still chose to give the penalty kick to Ross Barkley in Everton's match against Burnley. The core idea of the aspect is that it shows the trust and confidence that Martinez has in Barkley even if there's a more experienced option available for the duty.

Roberto Martinez, Everton's manager, had to defend his player Ross Barkley after Barkley missed a penalty in the 1-0 victory over Burnley on Saturday. Barkley had taken the penalty that would have given Everton an early lead, but his shot was saved by the Burnley goalkeeper. Martinez was forced to defend Barkley, as some critics believed that Barkley was not confident enough to take the penalty. However, Martinez insisted that Barkley was within his rights to request penalty-taking duties on Saturday, and that he was a vital part of the team.

The aspect states that Baines was happy to give Barkley penalty-taking duties. It implies that while Barkley missed the penalty shot, the team's regular penalty taker, Baines, was supportive and willing to let Barkley take on the responsibility. It suggests that Baines has faith in his teammate's abilities and is willing to share the load and support Barkley's development.

In soccer, placing a shot in the correct corner of the goal is crucial for the accuracy and effectiveness of the kick. When taking a penalty, a player's goal is to score by getting the ball past the goalkeeper. However, the corner of the goal is often an overlooked aspect, as it can determine the outcome of the game. In this case, Barkley's penalty was well-struck but it wasn't put in the corner, causing it to be less effective compared to if it was placed perfectly in the bottom right or bottom left corner. The aspect explains that even a well-struck penalty can be less effective if it is not placed in the right corner.

This aspect is expressing that the Burnley goalkeeper, Tom Heaton, saved Everton's penalty kick during their Premier League match on Saturday, which was taken by Ross Barkley in the 10th minute at Goodison Park.

The Aspect highlights that even though Ross Barkley missed a penalty in the 10th minute, it was fortunate for him that Kevin Mirallas scored the winning goal in the 77th minute. So, his missed penalty did not cost them the game ultimately.
